meanings.sent1: The mucros of the pencil can easily poke through paper.
meanings.sent2: Be careful with the mucros of the scissors; they can be sharp.
meanings.sent3: The cat played with the mucros of the curtain, pretending they were claws.
meanings.sent4: Her words had the mucros of a dagger, piercing through his heart.
meanings.sent5: The mucros of the rose thorn caught her finger, leaving a tiny puncture.

meanings.sent1: The mucros of the fork help in picking up food.
meanings.sent2: The rake's mucros make it easier to gather leaves.
meanings.sent3: He used the mucros of the comb to create a zigzag pattern in his hair.
meanings.sent4: The mucros of the antlers were impressive, showing the deer's strength.
meanings.sent5: The mucros of the key fit perfectly into the lock, turning it smoothly.

meanings.sent1: The mucros of the starfish help it move along the ocean floor.
meanings.sent2: The mucros of the icicle glistened in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: She used the mucros of the compass to draw a perfect circle.
meanings.sent4: The mucros of the mountain reached into the sky, touching the clouds.
meanings.sent5: The mucros of the arrow pointed directly at the target, ready to be released.
